lines.text: Drum and colours. Enter MALCOLM, SIWARD and YOUNG  SIWARD, MACDUFF, MENTEITH, CAITHNESS, ANGUS, LENNOX, ROSS, and Soldiers, marching

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: Cousins, I hope the days are near at hand That chambers will be safe.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: What wood is this before us?

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: Let every soldier hew him down a bough And bear't before him: thereby shall we shadow The numbers of our host and make discovery Err in report of us.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: We learn no other but the confident tyrant Keeps still in Dunsinane, and will endure Our setting down before 't.

lines.speaker: malcolm
lines.text: 'Tis his main hope: For where there is advantage to be given, Both more and less have given him the revolt, And none serve with him but constrained things Whose hearts are absent too.

lines.speaker: macduff
lines.text: Let our just censures Attend the true event, and put we on Industrious soldiership.

lines.speaker: siward
lines.text: The time approaches That will with due decision make us know What we shall say we have and what we owe. Thoughts speculative their unsure hopes relate, But certain issue strokes must arbitrate: Towards which advance the war.
